etymology.description: semantic: 石 (stone; rock) + phonetic: 馬 (OC *mraːʔ).
etymology.interpretation: Combines the stone semantic element with the phonetic 馬 to convey the reading mǎ. The stone component suggests concreteness or stacking (as in piling stones), while later senses like “number/code” and the unit “yard” developed through phonetic extension.
etymology.simplification: Replaced the phonetic component 馬 with its simplified form 马 while retaining 石; a right-side phonetic simplification.

examples.chinese: 请把代码发给我(請把代碼發給我)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ dàimǎ fā gěi wǒ.

examples.chinese: 一码等于三英尺(一碼等於三英尺)。
把箱子码整齐(把箱子碼整齊)。
